body:
The Upsurge in Hacker based activity: 
I am aware that this is a highly talked about topic but I do have some questions.  I went away on a 2 year break in which now I see far more hackers with a base of under 50 then there were with several 100.  I am wondering since my return of this has become an especially regular part of life of if this is just an organized attack against Avicus with several people with bots, maybe they will tire out.  But anyway it seems to be a problem that everyone knows about and since this is so widely talked about this is not new.  I just wanted to know if this is just more of a thing that will end after (of course it cannot end all of the way but I mean like all of the intensity and especially high amount of hackers).  Back in the olden days it was just spontaneous incidents but now it happens almost every game.  I am just hoping it is just a January thing and will die out. But since I am ignorant and in the dark about the Avicus experience with missing over 2 years of it, I would just like to know if this particular intensity and frequency of hacking happens every single day or if it is just a fad. I have no idea what is triggering this increase, people at times mention staff, but two years ago there were times when staff were not on as well and there was still much less hacking despite a much larger player base. There were also more servers back then and less supervision but still hackers did not strike as much as these days.  Have hackers in general just changed in 2 years of not playing minevraft, have they just become more relentless and annoying?  Have they evolved from having a life to not having a life?  Why do they have fun bbobing all over the place like Daffy Duck, don't they know that "Time is finite".  They  never succeed why keep doing it, they never get away with it.  If it is then so that this hacker frequency continues, I will just adjust to it being an every day fact of life that this particular amount of hacking now exists and go along with my day, just attempting to avoid hackers when I can, Avicus is fun so why would I leave it just at a moment of great excitement, a great new potential to regain a lot of its old members with an upincoming update.  I will just cowardly and dishonorably shoot people off 1 meter wide bridges so they fall into the void, with my relatively decent marksmanship and my lack of decency and integrity that should work and compensate for the deaths incurred from those hackers.  I guess I will just have to get used to the face of Guy Fawkes in the morning. Thank you for your time in reading this long question series and commentary, answering any answers or criticisms you put in the comments about my unoriginal topic, and have a great day.  (: (they don't allow emojis but that is a winking face)
-aagrant99 (Da Granster)

title: The Upsurge in Hacker-Based Activity

replies.body:
My guess:
Haven't even touched mc in about a year. If you assume that an average of 100 players comes on at one time, and you have a staff team of about over 30 staff, that consists of about 1/3 of the server. Although its not guaranteed that theyre all on at the same time, there should be enough to assume theres at least 2 online at once who can accurately deal with the issue. Therefore based on this logic I can't point at the staff for the reason behind this. I don't think theyre to blame. I could totally be wrong but I think its for another reason, such as they have no real reason to play on the server so find more fun in testing hacks.
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: Yeh it does seem likely that it is more just a natural thing days with mine craft on PC losing many players, it is actually growing in PC sales but less are actually playing it on PC which is heavily in contrast to the XBOX and Mobile additions.  Some of the staff are the same exact people from 2 years ago like "TheMasterClock" so it is not really their fault, back in those days staff were not always the most active either, though some were.  I think it is just people being bored in general, "like you said.  Thank you for sharing your view very agreeable.  1 more thing, I remember you MLGtino I used to play with you over 2 years ago, I have missed your presence.

replies.body:
The main reason is the shitty anti - hack. I've seen hundreds of videos of avicus when I search up "minecraft server with no anti hack" on YouTube. This again makes hundreds of hackers coming to avicus to use their hacks. 
Unfortunately this has been a problem a long time now, and probably won't get fixed any time soon.
